summary: The Republic of the Congo, also known as Congo-Brazzaville, is a Central African country on the Congo River's western coast. It has a rich history, with Bantu-speaking tribes dominating the region for thousands of years. The country was once part of French Equatorial Africa and gained independence in 1960. It experienced a Marxist-Leninist period from 1969 to 1992. Today, Congo is a member of various international organizations and is known for its oil production, which has brought some prosperity. Christianity is the dominant religion.
title: Republic of the Congo
